gov.anl.ipns.Util.Sys
Class StringUtil

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.Util.Sys.StringUtil

public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Provide utilities for fixing file names, parsing command lines, etc.

Method Detail

fixSeparator

public static java.lang.String fixSeparator(java.lang.String file_name)
Deprecated. replaced by setFileSeparator(String)

Replace all occurrences of the possible file separators "/", "\", "\\" with the file separator needed for the local system.

Parameters:
file_name - A file name string possibly containing improper separators.
Returns:
A string containing the file name with all separators replaced by system dependent separtator.

setFileSeparator

public static java.lang.String setFileSeparator(java.lang.String file_name)
Replace all occurrences of the possible file separators "/", "\", "\\" with the file separator needed for the local system.

Parameters:
file_name - A file name string possibly containing improper separators.
Returns:
A string containing the file name with all separators replaced by system dependent separtator.

replace

public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String in_string,
                                       java.lang.String old_chars,
                                       java.lang.String new_chars)
Replace all occurrences of a specified string by another string

Parameters:
in_string - the string in which the replacement is to be made.
old_chars - the string which is to be replaced.
new_chars - the string that replaces old_chars.
Returns:
A new string in which all occurences of the old_chars string are replaced by the new_chars string.

replace_token

public static java.lang.String replace_token(java.lang.String in_string,
                                             java.lang.String old_chars,
                                             java.lang.String new_chars)
Replace all occurrences of a specified string by another string, provide the occurrence of the string is bordered by non-alphanumeric characters or by the ends of the string. This is to allow replacing occurrence of variables such as t, t0, t1, etc. in expressions by other tokens. If the adjacent characters are not checked, just replacing all "t"s by "x" would damage "t0" and "t1".

Parameters:
in_string - the string in which the replacement is to be made.
old_chars - the string which is to be replaced.
new_chars - the string that replaces old_chars.
Returns:
A new string in which bounded occurences of the old_chars string are replaced by the new_chars string.

extract_tokens

public static java.lang.String[] extract_tokens(java.lang.String in_string,
                                                java.lang.String delimiters)
Produce an array of string "tokens" that are present in the specified string and separated by the specified delimiters.

Parameters:
in_string - the string from which the tokens are to be extracted
delimiters - the string containing the delimiters, eg: " ,;:\t\n\r\f"
Returns:
An array of strings containing the tokens

getCommand

public static java.lang.String getCommand(int num,
                                          java.lang.String command,
                                          java.lang.String s)
Find the argument following a specified occurence of a command in a string. Eg. If the string is "-D /home/dennis/ -Llog.txt -D/usr/data/" the, calling this method with num = 2, and command = "-D" will return "/usr/data/".

Parameters:
num - The number of the occurence of the command, 1, 2, etc.
command - The command to look for
s - The string containing commands and arguments with space between successive command-argument pairs.
Returns:
The string associated with the nth occurence of the given command.

getCommand

public static java.lang.String getCommand(int n,
                                          java.lang.String command,
                                          java.lang.String[] args)
Find the argument following a specified occurence of a command in a list of argument strings. The list of argument strings is concatenated and the resulting string is passed to the version of getCommand that takes a single string.

Parameters:
n - The number of the occurence of the command, 1, 2, etc.
command - The command to look for
args - The array of strings containing commands and arguments with space between successive command-argument pairs.
Returns:
The string associated with the nth occurence of the given command.

commandPresent

public static boolean commandPresent(java.lang.String command,
                                     java.lang.String[] args)
Determine whether or not the specified string occurs in the array of strings.

Parameters:
args - The array of strings containing commands and arguments with space between successive command-argument pairs or individual commands without arguments

nth_index_of

public static int nth_index_of(int n,
                               java.lang.String wanted,
                               java.lang.String s)
Find the "nth" occurence of a string in another string. This will return -1 if the specified occurence does not exist.

Parameters:
n - The number of the occurence of the wanted string that is being searched for
wanted - The string to search for
s - The string to search in
Returns:
The index of the first character of the "nth" occurence of the wanted string in the specified string s, if there is an "nth" occurence, -1 otherwise.

padSpacesLeft

public static java.lang.String padSpacesLeft(java.lang.String rs,
                                             int length)
Pad a string with spaces on the left.

Parameters:
rs - The String to pad.
length - The number of spaces to pad with.

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object object)
Method for turning an Object into a String that represents its value. This turns java.util.Collection and Arrays into a comma delimeted list with square brackets, these are only printed up to java's MAX_ARRAY_DEPTH values long.

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object object,
                                        boolean showAll)
Method for turning an Object into a String that represents its value. This turns java.util.Collection and Arrays into a comma delimeted list with square brackets, these are only printed up to java's MAX_ARRAY_DEPTH values long.

split

public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String string,
                                       java.lang.String splitter)
Method for splitting strings. Defaults to " " if second parameter is null. Now uses Java 1.4's split() method.

trim

public static void trim(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
Method analogous to String.trim().

getFloat

public static float getFloat(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Method to get the first set of non-whitespace characters and construct a float. The characters (and any separating whitespace) are then removed from the StringBuffer.

Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into a Float. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getFloat

public static float getFloat(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                             int nchar)
                      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Method to get the first nchar characters and construct a float. The characters are then removed from the StringBuffer.

Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into a Float. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getInt

public static int getInt(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
                  throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Method to get the first set of non-whitespace characters and construct an int. The characters (and any separating whitespace) are then removed from the StringBuffer.

Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into an Integer. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getInt

public static int getInt(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                         int nchar)
                  throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Method to get the first nchar characters and construct an int. The characters are then removed from the StringBuffer.

Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into an Integer. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getBoolean

public static boolean getBoolean(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Method to get the first set of non-whitespace characters and construct a boolean. The characters are then removed from the StringBuffer. Only "true" and "false" will be converted and everything else will create an exception. This is a case insensitive method.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into an boolean. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getBoolean

public static boolean getBoolean(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                 int nchar)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Method to get the first nchar characters and construct a boolean. The characters are then removed from the StringBuffer. Only "true" and "false" will be converted and everything else will create an exception. This is a case insensitive method.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when there is a problem converting the portion of the StringBuffer into an boolean. This will not remove that part from the StringBuffer.

getString

public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
Method to get the first set of non-whitespace characters and construct a String. The characters (and any separating whitespace) are then removed from the StringBuffer.

getString

public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                         int nchar)
Method to get the first nchar characters and construct a String. The characters are then removed from the StringBuffer.

getNumOccurrences

public static int getNumOccurrences(java.lang.String source,
                                    java.lang.String occ)
Utility to find the number of occurrences within a String. Currently uses Strings, so it could be sped up some. Note that this method is case-sensitive.

Parameters:
source - The String to find the occurrences in.
occ - The occurrence to find.

main
